reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price you pay, the hotel could be better. The room is very good, but there are some unusual bad aspects, like you cannot open the window, lack of water in one day (and soon after the water came with strange colours) and missing some articles, like robe for just one when we are in two people. The reception staff when we got to the hotel were not also very friendly, and he gave zero instructions about the hotel. We have also another problem, our credit card was charged twice (one without our authorization) and we have no appropriate explanations about that. The location is ok, next to a great mall and supermarket, but a bit far (about a 20 minutos walk) from the metro. Good aspects are the breakfast and the fitness area.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel! We are platnium members for the Marriott which gets us to a lot of their hotels around the world. This one is particular was an excellent Marriott with spacious lobby and many excellent ammenties. The best, being the concierge lounge with free Chilean wine and fantastic appetizers that changed each night. They were also open every night which is rare in the Marriott.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Great Concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The concierge manager greated us up in the lounge personally and and was awesome that we sent a bottle of wine and cheese plate to our room in addition to our usual arrival gift that we get.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel! Made my business trip to Chile very enjoyable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited every night and was greeted by the staff with our glass of favorite varietal wine that he remembered form the night before.
reviews.title: Nice Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The desk also was very nice and did everything that we needed in order to have a comfortable trip in Santiago! I must.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent only one night at this hotel at the tail end of our trip from Patagonia. We checked in after midnight and were so exhausted. The front desk upgraded us to executive floor, our room even had a conference room. The views were spectacular since we were on the 21st floor. We didn't need an adaptor for our U.S. plugs b/c the u.s. outlets were in the rooms as well as the chilean ones. The hotel even has its own helipad. Our stay was very comfortable, the rooms were very spacious. It's nice to stay at a marriott and know what quality to expect (no surprises that way). The next morning we walked to the train (Manequehue station - Red line) but learned that we can just hop in a cab from the station to hotel ~$4. Our train ride was only a little over ten minutes to downtown santiago or to Bellavista.
reviews.title: Spectacular views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very comfortable hotel for the business traveler. While I don't love the location (in a nice neighborhood, but not super central), I will very likely stay there again. The staff was extremely helpful, and could not have been nicer. And did I mention the view? Whatever I paid didn't come close to covering the price of the view. Absolutely spectacular-snow covered peaks everywhere.....
reviews.title: Comfortable room with spectacular views of the Andes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I absolutely loved Santiago, and my stay at the Marriott was nice. While the hotel was very lovely, and the rooms comfortable, our request when we booked to stay on a lower level floor was not fulfilled. The hotel is conveniently located and close to shopping.
reviews.title: Satisfying stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived with my wife for a 3-day weekend in Santiago, and had all sorts of problems with the hotel. And in every one of those, service and attention from the staff was terrible.
reviews.title: Totally overpriced for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Heat wasn't working. They kept saying the heat was working fine when it obviously had a problem since the room was very chilly. They ended up sending an electrical heater, and promised to switch us to a new room the next day, which they never did.
reviews.title: Really good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 days at this hotel. Overall, a nice hotel, but....
reviews.title: Good location;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Staff was professional but completely indifferent. For example, when we told them that the room was not getting cold water following a power outage the night before, the person at the front desk argued "no, we fixed that right away". Like we would lie or make it up? Or maybe we forgot how to use faucets? And then he simply resumed his work without apology or agreeing to follow-up. We were stunned. We were checking out so we dropped it, but YIKES, this isn't the Marriott-standard we were expecting for the prices we were paying. That's the most egregious example, but the staff in the hotel lounge were often of the same attitude. It seemed to us they were focused on their regular customers that work in the two adjoing office towers (they share the lobby), than they were on their hotel guests. Makes sense on one hand, but when you're the guest... well, it didn't feel good.
reviews.title: What a View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: On a positive note, we liked the location and we had beautiful sunset views from our room. The room itself was nice too (but there was a q-tip left on the carpet near the entry when we arrived - how do you miss that?). I just don't think we received the service we were paying for or expected from Marriott. Next time, I'll try another nearby hotel.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The view was AMAZING!!! The location was GREAT!!! The rooms were very SPACIOUS!!!
reviews.title: One of the best Hotels I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downside: Such a big hotel, it took forever to get to the lobby, especialy cause 1 elevator was always out of service. On our last day we never got our wake up call, 15 minutes late for our wine tour.
reviews.title: Overpriced for the kind of service offered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a Princess Cruise that disembarked in Valpariso, Chile on March 2, 3 days after the Concepion 8.8 earthquake. We had reserved one night at this hotel but because the airport was closed, we would stay until 3/7. The hotel and staff was very accommodating and understanding and took great care of us. The hotel had only minor damage and the rooms and restaurants were fine. The people staffing the Business Center were particularly helpful with searching for a flight back to the US. The rate was very good. Since we were "Princess Regugees" they made out situation bearable. The location is not near the city center but in a very nice area next to a shopping center. The bellmen and conceirage all were most helpful with arranging tours and giving directions. A really great hotel performing well in a tough situation.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 3 days stay post cruise. First couple days were fine, but on the last day series of after shock caused some anxious moments. I've read some negative reviews regarding front desk staff, but my experience was nothing but positive. We were expecting some irregularities, due to earthquake, but encountered no problems. Hotel restaurants are over priced, but Executive Level upgrade or Reward upgrade is worth it. Very nice lounge with very accommodating staff, nice happy hour and good selection for breakfast. Claudio and his staff was great!
reviews.title: Great property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Large shopping center with 800 shops in walking distance, as well as selection of restaurants. 20" cab ride to central zone, but hotel suggested not to ride a city taxi, so we didn't use the. Instead we used hotel reccommended sedan service for extra fee( $20 oneway) and called them for return. Very professional service, better to be safe than sorry, especially in major Latin American cities. Very minor damge by the earthquake, few broken windows and was in full operation. I was very pleased with their service.
reviews.title: Solid choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott is a very good hotel for business travelers and those who are out/about during the day sightseeing. I would not necessarily recommend this hotel for those who want to be in a walking neighborhood full of galleries and boutiques; for this, Providencia would be better, but most hotels there are like local bed & breakfasts without the infrastructure and amenities of a bigger name hotel. The Marriott is, however, within a 5 minute walk of a large shopping center with outdoor restaurants and mall-type shops. Marriott Concierge is very helpful and quick to respond to inquiries/requests. If possible, book the Concierge Lounge level (USD $40 extra per night), which offers free snacks throughout the day, a great view of the Andes from the lounge on the 23rd Floor, convenient WiFi (as opposed to going down to the main lobby) and a surprisingly comprehensive breakfast (pastries, yoghurts, juices fruits & other hot items) which more than makes up for the price.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this upscale Marriott in Feb. 2010 and absolutely loved it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but big city staff
